title: The 5 Jacket Trends New Yorkers Are Wearing to Elevate Their Basic Jeans
description: Give your denim outfit rotation an update.
excerpt: Looking for outfit ideas to update your denim outfit rotation? We've got all the inspiration you need from New Yorkers with the best style.
text: New Yorkers are unmatched when it comes to making even the most basic wardrobe pieces feel impossibly chic. The classic jeans-and-jacket combo? It’s their bread and butter. But this season, it’s all about the jackets. Whether you’re pairing them with relaxed denim or a sleek straight-leg fit, these outerwear trends are what every stylish NYC-er is reaching for.From relaxed, vintage-inspired straight-leg jeans to modern cropped flares, the denim of the season leans casual yet elevated. The magic happens when these staples are topped with the latest jacket trends—think cozy faux fur for bold nights out or tailored lady jackets for polished daytime looks. It’s a perfectly balanced mix of practicality and style that captures the city’s signature approach to winter dressing.Ready to give your denim lineup a winter-ready upgrade? Keep reading.1. The Suede JacketWhy it works: Suede jackets are a timeless choice, but this season’s versions have modern touches like shearling trims and oversized silhouettes. The soft texture adds warmth and sophistication to even the most basic jeans, making them ideal for everything from gallery hopping in Chelsea to weekend coffee runs in Williamsburg.(Image credit: @amaka.hamelijnck) BlankNYC Dirt Bike Jacket Madewell The Kline Blazer Suede Reformation Veda Luca Suede Jacket Free People Blair Faux Suede Jacket Nakedvice The Selene Jacket 2. The Lady JacketWhy it works: Think of the lady jacket as a polished upgrade to the classic blazer. With its boxy fit and structured details, it exudes quiet luxury without feeling too formal. Tweeds, bouclés, and pearl buttons are having a major moment, making this jacket the go-to for effortlessly chic layering. Alex Mill Paris Sweater Jacket L'agence Belmont Fringe Jacket Vince Double Wool Collarless Jacket 3. The Barn JacketWhy it works: Rugged yet refined, the barn jacket is proof that practical can also be fashionable. It’s the ideal layering piece for chilly mornings, offering warmth and just the right amount of edge. Corduroy collars, earthy tones, and utility pockets make this style feel rooted in tradition but totally cool in the city. Lioness Workwear Barn Jacket Line & Dot Bonny Barn Jacket Tibi Clyde Padding Shirt Jacket Lovers and Friends Mollie Jacket BlankNYC Country Club Jacket 4. The Funnel Neck JacketWhy it works: When temperatures dip, New Yorkers trade their scarves for funnel neck jackets. These high-collar styles offer both function and form, protecting against the wind while looking sleek and modern. Bonus: They look incredible zipped up or left slightly open. Lioness Madame Bomber Jacket Alexander Wang Oversized Unisex Funnel Neck Half Zip ZARA Wool Blend High Collar Jacket Laquan Smith Bomber Jacket With Front Placket 5. The Faux Fur JacketWhy it works: No one does drama quite like faux fur. Whether you go for a cropped leopard-print number or a longline neutral coat, this trend is guaranteed to make a statement. It’s cozy, chic, and undeniably New York. House of Sunny The Hustle Faux Fur Coat L'Academie Savoie Faux Fur Jacket Kitri Bonnie Faux Fur Vinyl Jacket Show Me Your Mumu Penny Lane Faux Leather Jacket Lovers and Friends Nina Faux Fur Jacket
html:
New Yorkers are unmatched when it comes to making even the most basic wardrobe pieces feel impossibly chic. The classic jeans-and-jacket combo? It’s their bread and butter. But this season, it’s all about the jackets. Whether you’re pairing them with relaxed denim or a sleek straight-leg fit, these outerwear trends are what every stylish NYC-er is reaching for.

From relaxed, vintage-inspired straight-leg jeans to modern cropped flares, the denim of the season leans casual yet elevated. The magic happens when these staples are topped with the latest jacket trends—think cozy faux fur for bold nights out or tailored lady jackets for polished daytime looks. It’s a perfectly balanced mix of practicality and style that captures the city’s signature approach to winter dressing.

Ready to give your denim lineup a winter-ready upgrade? Keep reading.

1. The Suede Jacket

Why it works: Suede jackets are a timeless choice, but this season’s versions have modern touches like shearling trims and oversized silhouettes. The soft texture adds warmth and sophistication to even the most basic jeans, making them ideal for everything from gallery hopping in Chelsea to weekend coffee runs in Williamsburg.

BlankNYC

Dirt Bike Jacket

Madewell

The Kline Blazer Suede

Reformation

Veda Luca Suede Jacket

Free People

Blair Faux Suede Jacket

Nakedvice

The Selene Jacket

2. The Lady Jacket

Why it works: Think of the lady jacket as a polished upgrade to the classic blazer. With its boxy fit and structured details, it exudes quiet luxury without feeling too formal. Tweeds, bouclés, and pearl buttons are having a major moment, making this jacket the go-to for effortlessly chic layering.

Alex Mill

Paris Sweater Jacket

L'agence

Belmont Fringe Jacket

Vince

Double Wool Collarless Jacket

3. The Barn Jacket

Why it works: Rugged yet refined, the barn jacket is proof that practical can also be fashionable. It’s the ideal layering piece for chilly mornings, offering warmth and just the right amount of edge. Corduroy collars, earthy tones, and utility pockets make this style feel rooted in tradition but totally cool in the city.

Lioness

Workwear Barn Jacket

Line & Dot

Bonny Barn Jacket

Tibi

Clyde Padding Shirt Jacket

Lovers and Friends

Mollie Jacket

BlankNYC

Country Club Jacket

4. The Funnel Neck Jacket

Why it works: When temperatures dip, New Yorkers trade their scarves for funnel neck jackets. These high-collar styles offer both function and form, protecting against the wind while looking sleek and modern. Bonus: They look incredible zipped up or left slightly open.

Lioness

Madame Bomber Jacket

Alexander Wang

Oversized Unisex Funnel Neck Half Zip

ZARA

Wool Blend High Collar Jacket

Laquan Smith

Bomber Jacket With Front Placket

5. The Faux Fur Jacket

Why it works: No one does drama quite like faux fur. Whether you go for a cropped leopard-print number or a longline neutral coat, this trend is guaranteed to make a statement. It’s cozy, chic, and undeniably New York.

House of Sunny

The Hustle Faux Fur Coat

Kitri
